Prompt: Estimate the total addressable market (TAM) for this company's primary product/service
Quality_Rules: Be specific with numbers; cite methodology (top-down/bottom-up); include growth rate if available
Sources: Industry reports (Gartner, IDC, Statista); company filings; analyst estimates
Good_Example: $47B - Enterprise cloud storage TAM based on Gartner 2024, growing 18% CAGR
Bad_Example: Large market; Lots of potential; Good opportunity
Fallback: Unable to estimate - insufficient industry data

Prompt: Assess competitive intensity in this company's primary market
Quality_Rules: Name actual competitors, not generic descriptions; explain WHY the level (barriers, saturation, etc)
Good_Example: High - Direct competition from AWS (60% share), Azure (25%), and GCP (10%) in cloud infrastructure
Fallback: Unable to assess - market not clearly defined

Prompt: Evaluate 3-5 year growth potential based on market trends and company position
Quality_Rules: Ground in data: market growth rates, company metrics, macro trends; avoid generic optimism
Sources: Market research; company announcements; economic indicators
Good_Example: High - Cloud spending growing 20% YoY (Gartner); company's AI features align with enterprise demand
Bad_Example: High - Great product with lots of upside; Growing fast
Fallback: Unable to assess - insufficient company/market data

Prompt: Find the most recent funding round or financial event for this company
Quality_Rules: Only include verified funding; distinguish between rumored and confirmed; note if company is public/bootstrapped
Sources: Crunchbase; TechCrunch; company press releases; SEC filings
Good_Example: $150M Series C - led by Sequoia Capital (TechCrunch, Jan 2024)
Fallback: No recent funding found in public sources

Prompt: Identify CEO and 2-3 key executives with their backgrounds
Quality_Rules: Verify current roles (people change jobs); include relevant experience only
Good_Example: CEO: Sarah Chen (ex-VP Engineering, Google Cloud); CTO: Mike Rodriguez (co-founder, prev. startup acquired by Microsoft)
Bad_Example: Has experienced leadership; Good management team

Prompt: Find the most recent valuation or market cap
Quality_Rules: Distinguish: funding valuation vs market cap vs analyst estimate; note if outdated (>12mo)
Sources: PitchBook; Bloomberg; SEC filings; funding announcements
